stanza.line: In faith I do not love thee with mine (a)eyes(/a)
For they in thee a thousand errors (b)note(/b)
But 'tis my heart that loves what they (a)despise(/a)
Who in despite of view is pleased to (b)dote(/b)
Nor are mine cars with thy tongue's tune (c)delighted(/c)
Nor tender feeling to base touches (d)prone(/d)
Nor taste nor smell desire to be (c)invited(/c)
To any sensual feast with thee (d)alone(/d)
But my five wits nor my five senses (e)can(/e)
Dissuade one foolish heart from serving (f)thee(/f)
Who leaves unswayed the likeness of a (e)man(/e)
Thy proud heart's slave and vassal wretch to (f)be(/f)
Only my plague thus far I count my (g)gain(/g)
That she that makes me sin awards me (g)pain(/g)
